predictions.text: ISM Services PMI (headline) for October 2025 will print between 51.0 and 53.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the headline ISM Services PMI for Oct 2025 from the Institute for Supply Management's official release; the value must lie within [51.0, 53.5].
evidence: October services subindices expectations: employment soft, prices firm, new orders resilient (see related forecasts).
Recent mixed growth signals: resilient consumer, tariff pass-through risk, airline disruptions may weigh modestly.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global US Services PMI final
High-frequency card/pos data (Bank of America/Chase)
Conference Board Consumer Confidence
Airline capacity/cancellations impact on services activity
predictions.rationale: Mixed but expansionary services momentum with price pressure; shutdown-related disruptions cap upside.

predictions.text: Google will close its $32B acquisition of Wiz by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: An official closing announcement from Google/Alphabet or Wiz (press release, SEC filing, or corporate blog) confirming transaction completion on or before 2026-03-31.
evidence: Google gets U.S. government’s green light to acquire Wiz for $32B (TechCrunch, 2025-11-05): https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/05/google-gets-the-us-governments-green-light-to-acquire-wiz-for-32b/
Deal rationale strengthens Google Cloud security amid AI platform competition.
monitoring_signals: Regulatory clearances in remaining jurisdictions (EU, UK, Israel)
Any shareholder approvals or closing conditions updates
Reported deal financing and integration plans from Google Cloud
predictions.rationale: Key U.S. clearance secured; typical remaining approvals and integration planning suggest timely close barring unexpected regulatory delays.

predictions.text: The TSA 7-day moving average of U.S. checkpoint throughput will be at least 5% below the comparable 2024 7-day average on at least one day by 2025-11-20.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using TSA daily checkpoint numbers (https://www.tsa.gov/travel/passenger-volumes): compute the 7-day moving average ending each day and compare to the 7-day average ending the same calendar date in 2024. A decline of ≥5% on any day by 2025-11-20 satisfies.
evidence: FAA cutting flight capacity 10% at 40 major airports amid shutdown (CNBC, 2025-11-05): https://www.cnbc.com/2025/11/05/faa-cuts-flight-capacity-shutdown.html
Shutdown-related staffing constraints likely to dampen travel volumes near-term.
monitoring_signals: TSA daily throughput series and 7-day average
FAA operational advisories and ATC staffing updates
Flight cancellations/delays (FlightAware)
Airline schedule changes (OAG, Cirium)
predictions.rationale: Capacity reductions and operational frictions from the shutdown should temporarily suppress throughput versus last year.

predictions.text: From 2025-11-06 close to 2025-11-30 close, U.S. Global Jets ETF (JETS) will underperform SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) by at least 2.0 percentage points on an adjusted-close basis.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using adjusted closes (e.g., Yahoo Finance), compute total-return percentage change for JETS and SPY from 2025-11-06 close to 2025-11-30 close. JETS return minus SPY return ≤ -2.0 percentage points.
evidence: FAA capacity cuts and likely prolonged recovery (CNBC, 2025-11-05): https://www.cnbc.com/2025/11/05/faa-cuts-flight-capacity-shutdown.html
Travel disruptions pressure airline revenues and costs; broad market less affected.
monitoring_signals: ATC staffing and capacity utilization updates
Airline guidance revisions and PRASM trends
Jet fuel prices (Gulf Coast Kero/Jet ULSD differential)
SPY/JETS relative momentum and options skew
predictions.rationale: Operational constraints and revenue risk likely drag airlines versus broader equities into month-end.

predictions.text: The U.S. 2-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS2) will close at or below 4.40% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via FRED DGS2 daily series or U.S. Treasury daily yields that DGS2 closes ≤ 4.40% on any trading day by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Cooling wage growth and contained core inflation forecasts for October support lower front-end yields.
Shutdown-related growth headwinds and Fed on-hold stance modestly favor duration.
monitoring_signals: CPI/PPI October prints
Average Hourly Earnings (Oct) and NFP
FOMC communications and OIS-implied path
Auction demand (2Y, 5Y) and term premium proxies
predictions.rationale: Slight downside skew to front-end yields given softening inflation and growth signals.

predictions.text: Cboe VVIX Index will close at or above 100.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Using Cboe data or reputable market data sources, confirm any daily close of VVIX ≥ 100.0 by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Policy and macro event cluster (shutdown, CPI, retail sales) can stoke demand for VIX options.
Recent equity breadth fragility increases tail-hedging propensity.
monitoring_signals: Term-structure slope (VIX9D/VIX/VXV)
S&P 500 skew and VVIX intraday spikes
Macro surprise index and event calendar density
Dealer gamma positioning
predictions.rationale: Event risk and hedging demand could briefly elevate VIX option volatility.

predictions.text: COMEX Copper front-month futures (HG) will settle at or above $4.00 per pound on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via CME settlement data that the prompt-month HG contract closes ≥ $4.00/lb on any trading day by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Stabilizing global services activity (e.g., China Caixin Services PMI range) supports demand.
AI/data center buildouts and grid investment underpin medium-term copper demand.
monitoring_signals: China credit impulse and property policy headlines
LME copper stocks and SHFE inventory trends
USD DXY level and real yields
Chinese import data for copper concentrates
predictions.rationale: Macro stabilization with tight inventories can lift copper to test $4.00.

predictions.text: Silver (XAGUSD spot) will trade at or above $30.00 on at least one UTC day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify any intraday print of XAGUSD ≥ $30.00 on TradingView/Bloomberg/Refinitiv during a UTC day by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Potential dip in real yields and softer dollar would support precious metals.
Industrial demand tailwinds from solar and electronics complement safe-haven flows.
monitoring_signals: 10Y TIPS real yield
DXY and EURUSD trends
ETF silver holdings (SLV inflows)
Solar installation data and panel prices
predictions.rationale: Falling real yields and industrial demand could catalyze a breakout toward $30.

predictions.text: U.S. motor gasoline product supplied (4-week average) will print at or below 8.60 million b/d in at least one EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report; confirm the 4-week moving average of motor gasoline product supplied ≤ 8.60 mb/d in any report released by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Travel disruptions and seasonal shoulder period typically dampen demand.
FAA capacity restrictions could further suppress near-term gasoline usage.
monitoring_signals: EIA weekly demand and implied product supplied
TSA throughput and airline schedules
Retail gasoline prices (AAA)
Regional demand indicators (PADD-level draws)
predictions.rationale: Seasonal slowdown plus travel constraints likely push 4-week average lower.

predictions.text: EUR/USD will trade at or below 1.0600 on at least one UTC day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm any intraday print of EURUSD ≤ 1.0600 on a reputable FX data source (Bloomberg/Refinitiv/TradingView) during a UTC day by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Growth and policy divergence risk: U.S. resilience vs. euro area softness.
Tariff/policy headlines and risk-off flows can lift USD selectively.
monitoring_signals: U.S.–EU rate differentials (2Y swap spread)
DXY trajectory
Euro area PMIs and energy prices
Risk sentiment (VIX, credit spreads)
predictions.rationale: Modest downside tail for EUR on growth divergence and dollar safety bid.
